intro: Centaurea leucantha, commonly known as the white centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with white ray florets that bloom in summer. Centaurea leucantha is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
